results.title: The Health food movement
results.brief_description: The basic terms used by the health food movement are defined, and the activities of three typical health food advocates are used to explain details of the movement; an organic gardener, a manager of a health foods store, and a young family who eat mainly “natural foods”.
results.description: The basic terms used by the health food movement are defined, and the activities of three typical health food advocates are used to explain details of the movement; an organic gardener, a manager of a health foods store, and a young family who eat mainly “natural foods”.

results.title: Heads
results.creator_credit: David Corke, George Dixon and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit
results.brief_description: An experimental film by a group of young Victorian filmmakers. Nonchalantly, the cleaner dusts the works of art created by ancient Greek potters, Renaissance painters and modern sculptors. Each piece marks the stage in our progress as percipient thinking beings: civilisations mature and die - but we survive, at least until today. As the cleaner blows dust from the ear of Epstein’s Einstein, he is ignorant of the terrible forces such a mind has unleashed; for good or ill these forces can, almost, be directed by a toss of a coin.

results.title: The Head on collision
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Made for the Department of Transport, this film shows distractions both inside and outside the car, tiredness, “highway hypnosis”, and alcohol - as the major causes of head-on collisions. Explains how these can be avoided. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Head of the house
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: A story of community action in mental health, showing how a social worker, a policeman and a minister join forces to help a young boy through the vicissitudes of growing up. This film stresses the relationship between the authoritarian attitudes of a father to his son and the boy’s psychological difficulties.

results.title: The Story of Long John
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: A film about the establishment of a new Long John Scotch Whisky at Tormore in the Scottish Highlands - the first completely-built distillery in the highlands in the 20th century. Workers’ homes and the distillery were designed to fit in with the landscape. Tormore was chosen because of its water quality. The process of distilling and blending is also featured.

results.title: Hazard
results.creator_credit: Tom Stobart, Geoffrey Sumner and Interfilm Productions
results.brief_description: An accident prevention film intended primarily for showing to new workers entering the steel industry. Aims at a person’s attitude to safety rather than suggesting specific safety rules, through the story of two steelworkers on a mountaineering holiday. Compares their attitude to risks in the mountains with a professional attitude to risks on the job.

results.title: Hayes Jones
results.creator_credit: Hugh King, Jerry Forman, Daniel Ruffini and Allegro Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
The story of New York’s new Commissioner of Recreation, a newly created post. Hayes Jones, former Olympic high hurdler, administers 900 parks, is activity director for eight million people and supervisor of 12,000 employees. We follow him through a typical working day.
